title: Outback reality TV star to sell famed NT pub oasis
text:
One of the country's legendary outback roadhouses, the Top Springs Hotel in the Northern Territory, has been listed for sale by former reality television star and cattle baron Milton Jones.

The remote hotel and pub, surrounded by huge cattle stations and little else, lies 291 kilometres south of Katherine on the junction of the Buntine and Buchanan Highways and forms part of the Savannah Way travel route from Cairns to Broome.

An oasis for some: The Top Springs Hotel.

It serves as a popular stopping-off point for parched and tired truck drivers and tourists in need of a steak sandwich, beer and bed. Its 29 hotel rooms are often in high demand, especially during the annual campdraft – a competition in which horseback riders muster a steer or heifer – at Pussycat Bore, 30km away.

The hotel has been listed for sale by Olivia Thompson from Landmark Harcourts, with an asking price of $3 million.

Mr Jones, owner of the 5000sq km Coolibah Station, starred alongside his family in Channel Ten's Keeping Up with the Joneses, about life on an outback cattle station.
description: The hotel was originally built to service drovers driving cattle on the Buchanan Stock Route from the western side of the Top End through to Queensland
